Detroit Free Press 1 of 5 x Share MIKE ILITCH, LEGENDARY SPORTS OWNER, PIZZA MAGNATE DEAD AT 87 Detroit Red Wings, Tigers owner Mike Ilitch dies at 87 | 0:54 Mike Ilitch, owner of the Detroit Tigers and Red Wings and founder of Little Caesars, died at the age of 87. Video by Anthony Fenech/DFP 3 of 5 x Share MIKE ILITCH, LEGENDARY SPORTS OWNER, PIZZA MAGNATE DEAD AT 87 Detroit shuttle bus driver reacts to death of Mike Ilitch | 0:52 Rich Sanchez, 66, of Detroit, a shuttle bus driver for Tommy's bar, called Mike Ilitch "The Godfather of Detroit." Ann Zaniewski/Detroit Free Press 4 of 5 x Share MIKE ILITCH, LEGENDARY SPORTS OWNER, PIZZA MAGNATE DEAD AT 87 Mike Ilitch: Tigers' Victor Martinez a special guy | 1:53 The Tigers owner is glad to have the designated hitter back in Detroit. Video by George Sipple, DFP. 5 of 5 Detroit Red Wings, Tigers owner Mike Ilitch dies at 87 Our last interview: Ilitch not worried about spending for Tigers Detroit shuttle bus driver reacts to death of Mike Ilitch Mike Ilitch: Tigers' Victor Martinez a special guy Sports Business Journal reported in 2014 about the late Tigers, Red Wings owner's good deed for a civil rights icon Buy Photo The late Tigers and Red Wings owner Mike Ilitch reportedly paid Rosa Parks' rent from 1994 until her death in 2005. (Photo: Free Press news service photos) Buy Photo CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
We're sure Detroit sports fans everywhere have spent some time reminiscing about their favorite Detroit Tigers and Detroit Red Wings memories over the past few decades following news breaking of the death of Mike Ilitch on Friday. 
Here's a heartwarming story you may have missed about the team owner and pizza magnate: Ilitch once paid for civil rights activist Rosa Parks' rent from 1994 until her death in October 2005. 
Parks, considered "the first lady of civil rights," had moved to Detroit in 1957 following her famous resistance to racial segregation in 1955. 
As reported by Christopher Botta of Sports Business Journal in 2014: 
On Aug. 31, 1994, Parks, then 81, was robbed and assaulted in her home in central Detroit. (Judge Damon) Keith called real estate developer Alfred Taubman, the owner of Riverfront Apartments, about finding a safer home for Parks. Taubman pledged to find the best home available. 
When Ilitch read about Keith’s plan and Taubman’s promise in the newspaper, he called the judge and said he would pay for Parks’ housing for as long as necessary. (Parks passed away in 2005 at the age of 92). Keith served as the executor of the trust established for Parks’ housing. Remembering Mike Ilitch Chris Ilitch now in charge of dad's empire under succession plan 
The story also shows a picture of Keith with a copy of a $2,000 check that Ilitch's Little Caesars Enterprises made toward Riverfront Apartments on Nov. 1, 1994. 
“It’s important that people know what Mr. Mike Ilitch did for Ms. Rosa Parks because it’s symbolic of what he has always done for the people of our city," Keith told the Sports Business Journal in 2014. 
Indeed, it's another example of the kind of impact Ilitch made on the city of Detroit and its people throughout his life. 
Ilitch passed away Friday at 87 years old , according to his company, Ilitch Holdings, and his family will honor him in a private funeral service. 
Do you have a story to share about Ilitch? Post it on our legacy wall - or simply use it to express your condolences. 
Contact Brian Manzullo: bmanzullo@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @BrianManzullo . 
Be sure that you follow the Detroit Free Press on Twitter ( @freep ) and Instagram and like us on on Facebook . Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Ilitch also played for the Tigers' farm system in the 1950s.
